title: Ticket #1715: print more info, maybe except, if log file unmonitor fails
description: Pegasus just ran into a case where (among other problems) unmonitoring a log file failed. That is something that should never happen. At minimum, if it happens we should print out a list of all log file monitor objects that exist, and we should probably except.
remarks:
I've added printing more info for 7.4.5; I'm planning to add the excepting for 7.5.5.

2010-Oct-28 15:50:23 by wenger:
The 7.5 branch now excepts in the DAGMan Job code if monitoring or unmonitoring a log file fails.
check_ins:
2010-Oct-28 15:47   Check-in [25755]: gittrac #1715: DAGMan now excepts in the case of certain log file errors, when continuing would be likely to put it into an incorrect internal state. (By Kent Wenger )
2010-Oct-28 15:17   Check-in [19254]: gittrac #1715: DAGMan now excepts in the case of certain log file errors, when continuing would be likely to put it into an incorrect internal state. (By Kent Wenger )
2010-Oct-20 09:47   Check-in [25766]: Documented fixes to gittrac #1713 (print info when truncating a node job user log file) and #1715 (print more info, if log file unmonitor fails). (By Kent Wenger )
2010-Oct-14 15:39   Check-in [19169]: gittrac #1715: we print additional info if we fail to successfully unmonitor a log file. Also removed unneeded newlines from some error strings. (By Kent Wenger )
creator: wenger
